tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

node.description:
[Official Website](https://tamurayumi.com/)

Yumi Tamura is a Japanese manga artist. Her debut short story, Ore-tachi no Zettai Jikan ("This is the Time for Us"), was published in 1983 in Bessatsu Shoujo Comic and received the 1983 Shogakukan Grand Prize for new artists.

She made her reputation with the long-running shoujo action/adventure series [Basara](https://anilist.co/manga/30974/), for which she won the 1993 Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga. Her series [7SEEDS](https://anilist.co/manga/31075/) won a second Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga in 2003.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
Yukio Takahashi is an episode director.

Originating from M.S.C.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the CG artist or the sound producer._

**Height:** 152 cm

[Website](https://kamishiraishimone.com/) | [Web Diary](https://ameblo.jp/mone-kamishiraishi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mone_tohoent) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mone_kamishiraishi/) 

Kamishiraishi Mone is a Japanese actress and singer managed by Toho Entertainment. Her music label is Universal Music Japan. She spent three years of her childhood in Mexico. Due to that, she became fluent in English and is able to speak basic Spanish. She is the older sister of actress [Kamishiraishi Moka](https://anilist.co/staff/130649/Kamishiraishi-Moka).

She is also known for her voice acting as Miyamizu Mitsuha in the movies "Kimi no Na wa (Your Name)" in 2016 and "Tenki no Ko (Weathering With You)" in 2019. On December 24, 2020, it was announced that she will play the main role of Yasuko in the 105th Asadora "Come Come Everybody". Kamishiraishi Mone was selected through an audition from 3061 applicants.
From February to July 2022, she played Chihiro in the stage play "Spirited Away" from Studio Ghibli.
In March and April 2023, she will play the main role of Jane Eyre in the musical “Jane Eyre” directed by John Caird.

__[Website](https://cidergirl.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cidergirl_info)__

__Formed:__ 2014
__Genres:__ Rock

__Introduction:__
Cidergirl is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Universal J, having previously been under CIDER RECORDS (2015–2016). They made their major debut in 2017.

__Members:__
- [Yurin](https://anilist.co/staff/169465) (ゆりん) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Tomo](https://twitter.com/ramu_gt) (知, とも) – guitarist
- [Fujimura](https://twitter.com/moff_P) (フジムラ) – bassist
- Shintani Manager (深谷マネージャー) – drummer and manager (2017–Oct. 2018, May. 2019–)

__Former Members:__
- [Toruru](https://twitter.com/twittoruru) (トルル) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- [komaki](https://twitter.com/komaki1986) – drummer 
- [Chihiro Hosokawa](https://twitter.com/sngk_hskw) (細川千弘) – drummer
- [Yuusuke Yoshida](https://twitter.com/yoshidayusuke) (吉田雄介), better known by stage name Yoshida-kun (吉田くん) – drummer and percussionist
